plan: To maximize profit, I will analyze previous rounds to determine Bidder Betty’s and Bidder Charles' average and maximum bids. I will start by bidding slightly above my value for A and B individually, testing their responses. If I lose, I will incrementally increase my bids to gauge their maximum. To secure AB, I will bid my total value for the round for a few rounds, observing their reactions and calculating profits. Then, I might switch to more aggressive strategy by bidding high on either A or B while watching their trends and re-assess.

For the next round, I'll test an aggressive approach by bidding close to my value on AB (164) to gain both goods. In parallel, I'll place smaller fees on A and B individually as a backup plan. However, I'll keep my bids on A (51) and B (31) at about 70-80% of their values to ensure profitability. I'll also record and study the bidding patterns of opponents Andy and Charles from previous rounds to refine future tactics. Finally, I'll continue to tweak my strategy based on outcomes and new value draws for each round.

Plan to initiate with safe bidding in first few rounds, sticking to 50-70% of my value for A or B. If high competition or generally low bids are observed, strategically test aggressive higher bidding on both goods (up to 90% of AB value). Also, experiment with lower bids on individual goods with high bids on combination AB. Evaluate leading preferences of others to capitalize. Adapt strategy based on feedback after each round, honing in on the most profitable thresholds.

Continue studying others' bids, bid slightly above values for A (94) and B (26). For AB, bid at total value (232) to collect data. Adapt and increase bids if losing. Maintain focus on long-term profit maximization.
I'll bid aggressively close to my value on AB (100), place low bids on A (36) & B (3) as standby options. Observing Charles and Andy's patterns and readjusting strategy accordingly.

Increase bids on individual goods, aiming to win at least one. Test a higher bid for AB, approximating 85% of value, depending on competitors' tendency. Adapt strategy based on this round's results. Maintain focus on profitability rather than winning. Less aggressive bidding if competition is high.

This round, I'll decrease my bid slightly on A and B individually, saving costs yet likely winning. I'll also decrease my AB bid moderately to test others' reactions, maintaining my winning position but increasing profit margin.

I'll bid closer to value for AB (128), maintaining 70-80% of individual values for A (22) & B (25). Continual assessment of Andy and Charles' bidding patterns will shape strategy adjustments. Profit maximization remains the primary objective.

For the next round, I will increase bids on A and B to $55 and $29 respectively, closer to their actual value. Given the high competition for AB, I will place a higher bid at $210 (approx. 95% of value). Adapt strategy based on results.

Given previous rounds, adjust bidding strategy to bid $73 on A, $18 on B independently, and bid $180 for AB. This conserves capital while testing lower bids for A and B and a significantly decreased AB bid.

Planning to bid higher on AB, around $260, remaining aggressive. I'll place individual bids on A ($33) and B ($70) lower than my valuations for backup. I'll continuously revise my bidding patterns based on outcomes and opponent strategies.

For the next round, I plan to bid cautiously closer to the 80% of my value on good A and B individually. Experiment with lowering my AB bundle bid closer to 90% of its value, relying on previous winning experience.

I plan to underbid on A and B individually to $54 and $73 respectively. For AB, I'll revise my strategy and inflate my bid to $260, anticipating a chance of securing both goods and maximizing my profit.

Focus on 'AB' with high bid around my value (~191). Simultaneously, lower individual bids (~70% of values) on A and B for backups. Adjust strategy built on historical data, current round outcomes, and competitors’ patterns, aiming to optimize profits.

Plan to increase bids for A between 75-85% of my value, given its higher win potential. Avoid bidding for B or AB due to low and zero valuation respectively. Adjust bids based on outcomes and market competition.

Given history, I'll bid conservatively for A and B (around $45 and $2 respectively), saving resources. For AB, I'll reduce my bid to $200, still competitive but maximizing profit potential. This moderate strategy balances winning chances and profit optimisation.

Plan briefly: I'll add $10 on my bid for 'A' (90), add $15 for 'B' (82), and significantly increase 'AB' by $70 (364). The risk increases with 'AB' bid, yet it's the best shot given my high combined value. Adjustments will continue based on outcomes.

Given high valuations for A (97) and AB (300), strive to win these. Increase bids to approximately 85% value for A, experiment with aggressive 95% bid for AB. Retain low bids for B due to lower valuation (53), but remain adaptable based on observed competitive tendencies.

In the next round, I plan to significantly increase my bid on B, moderately raise my bid on A, and slightly inflate my AB bid. By bidding reasonably above my valuations, I'm targeting a balance between winning goods and profitable outcomes.

Since aggressive bidding led to losses, I'll adopt a less risky strategy by bidding closer to 70% of my valuations on 'A' and 'B'. The 'AB' bid will be slightly less than actual value. I'll also monitor trends and adjust accordingly.

Plan to bid approximately 80% value on A ($68) due to high valuation. As B has lower value, bid around 40% ($19). For AB, attempt conservative strategy, bidding around 85% ($224). Observe market competition in this round and adjust strategies accordingly for future rounds.
Next, I'll drop my individual bids for A to $75 and B to $19, while also lowering my AB bid to $215. This conservates resources, staying competitive while maximizing potential profit.

Given the draw, I'll bid close to my values for A (45) and B (43), and aggressively for AB (176). Learning from previous rounds, I'll increase my bids for 'B' more confidently. I'll remain adaptable to opponent strategies.

My plan is to slightly decrease bids on A and B to boost profits, while significantly raising the bid for AB to increase chances of acquisition. I will assess market competition and adjust bidding strategies accordingly to ensure a balance between risk and profit potential.

I'll bid close to second highest recent bids, i.e., $65 for A, $24 for B, and $190 for AB bundle. This strategy should maintain competitiveness while potentially increasing margins to maximize long-term profit.

In the upcoming rounds, I'll implement a dual strategy: bid close to value on A and higher on B, while considering a slightly more aggressive stance on AB. Re-evaluate strategy based on observed outcomes to maximize profits.

Given high valuation for B, bid aggressively (90%). Maintain A bid around 80% due to these competitive situations. Experiment with a lower AB bid (80%) to observe outcomes. Evaluate and adapt based on results.

Plan to aggressively bid on AB with a value around $220 while cutting down individual bids on A and B to conserve resources. Constantly adapt strategies based on others' reactions while balancing winning chances and profit maximization.

My strategy for the next round includes bidding less aggressively on AB, close to the next highest competitors' bid based on historical data. For A and B, I'll aim to bid just above the second-highest previous bid to secure individual items at lower prices, maximizing profit.

Given high valuation for B (96), plan to bid around 90% of the value (86). For A, bid at approximately 75% due to lower value. To maximize chances for AB, experiment with a bid closer to the real combined value, around 90% of 189.

I plan to slightly underbid on A and B, likely winning while saving costs. For AB, I'll reduce my bid moderately, maintaining competitiveness but maximizing profit. I'll observe others' strategies and continuously adapt based on my analysis of bidding trends and profits.

Based on previous rounds, I plan to reduce A bid closer to my valuation, increase B to secure a win, and place an AB bid slightly above average past bids to explore winning with a good margin, maximising profits while minimizing risk.

Plan to strategize based on individual A and B values. Bid aggressively on high-value items (90%), maintain conservative bids on lower values. Observe market tendencies, cautiously bid on AB bundle (80-85%), focusing on profitability and competition. Adapt bidding range accordingly.

Analyzing previous rounds, for individual goods, bid slightly under drawn values to increase profit margin, while remaining competitive. For AB, bid close to the total value and study reactions. Adapt strategies based on observed trends, balancing winning chances with profit maximization.

Next round, I'll bid close to my values for A and B individually for safety. Though riskier, I'll bid aggressively for AB close to my combined valuation. This approach may yield potential profit insights and inform future strategy adjustments.

My plan is to bid more competitively on individual items A (70% value) and B (60% value) since values are quite high. For AB, I'll raise my bid to approximately 95% of its combined value, considering high competition observed in previous rounds and my high valuation.

My next strategy involves slightly increasing individual bids (around $5 more each) while keeping AB bid competitive yet profitable, slightly higher than current total value. I will adjust bids based on outcomes, focusing on maximizing long-term profit and gaining insights on competitors' strategies.

I'll proceed strategically, bidding closer to my value for AB (~85), maintaining individual bids lower (~70% of values) for A (13.3) & B (16.1). Careful tracking of Andy and Charles' bidding patterns will allow adaptive tactics. Profit maximization remains the primary intent.

I plan to aggressively bid for A (around 90% value) due to high valuation, while maintaining conservative bids on B (around 70%). For AB, I will place a high bid close to 95% of its combined value. I will adjust approach based on each round's results and competitors' strategies.

In the next round, I'll moderately raise bids for A and B to challenge the lowest winning bid, while aggressively increasing my AB bundle bid above 215 to attempt securing both goods, balancing between competitive edge and profit maximization.

Strategy for next round includes placing conservative bids on A (10) and aggressive bids on B (30), while moderately increasing AB bid (105). It involves strategical balancing of bids with calculated risk to max out profitability.

Plan to maintain aggressive bidding on high-value B, while decreasing A bids to around 60%. For AB, bid up to 90% of combined value. Monitor competitors' behaviours, adapt bids accordingly to balance winning and optimizing profit.

I plan to lower A and B bids by $5 and $3 respectively while keeping a competitive edge. For AB, I'll significantly decrease bid by $100, observing how this substantial decrease influences others' strategies and maximizes my long-term profit.

For next round, increase AB bid to around $230, focusing more on securing AB. Keep individual A and B bids low to reduce risk and ensure profitability. Monitor trends in Andy and Charles' bids to adapt and optimize strategy for future rounds.

Intend to bid aggressively (90% value) on high-valued items and conservatively (around 60%-70%) on low-valued ones. For AB, I'll experiment with a bid of around 95% of its value. Adapt these percentages based on competitive tendencies observed in previous rounds while maximizing long-term profitability.
